Base Excision Repair(BER):
1. DNA glycosylases cleave the N-glycosidic bond and generate AP sites (Abasic sites). Different DNA glycosylases are used to remove different damaged bases.

2. AP endonucleases cleave the DNA at the site of damage.

3. dRpase (Deoxyribophosphodiesterase) removes several sugar-phosphate residue.

4. DNA polymerase inserts new stretch of DNA and the gap is sealed by DNA ligase.

quote.msg:
Base Excision Repair(BER):
1. DNA glycosylases cleave the N-glycosidic bond and generate AP sites (Abasic sites). Different DNA glycosylases are used to remove different damaged bases.

2. AP endonucleases cleave the DNA at the site of damage.

3. dRpase (Deoxyribophosphodiesterase) removes several sugar-phosphate residue.

4. DNA polymerase inserts new stretch of DNA and the gap is sealed by DNA ligase.

replies.msg:
Nucleotide Excision Repair (NER):
- It repairs a range of DNA damage while BER repairs lesions for specific DNA glycosylase.

1. The damaged strand is cleaved on either side of the side of lesions.

2. The damaged single strand DNA is displaced.

3. DNA polymerase synthesizes new DNA to fill the gap and seals the nick by DNA ligase

quote.msg:

2. AP endonucleases cleave the DNA at the site of damage.

3. dRpase (Deoxyribophosphodiesterase) removes several sugar-phosphate residue.

4. DNA polymerase inserts new stretch of DNA and the gap is sealed by DNA ligase.

Why did previous species of Homo genus not able to leave Africa?
1. Intelligence
They are less intelligent so they cant cope/adapt quick enough to a changing environment.
2. Energetics
They are not energetically efficient. They dont have enough energy to travel such long distance.
3. Habitat
The environment isnt favorable. For example, arid environment such as Saharah Desert, Arabic Desert, doesnt allow them to leave Africa.

1. Homo erectus was the first homo genus species to leave Africa.
Splitters:
Different species unless there is convincing reason to unite them.
Lumpers:
Same species unless there is convincing reason to divide them.

Human has better anatomy and behaviour than Neanderthals.
Neanderthals:
Male and female did everything together.
Modern human:
Males hunted, females gathered.
Neanderthals are inefficient.

replies.msg:
Lekking behaviour:
Males gather to engage a competitve displays. They fight each other in order to attract females.

Courtship feeding:
- the male bird offers food to his mate
- it occurs during egg formation, laying and incubation
- it can provide a valuable source of nutrients for females

Sperm competition:
The sperm will be stored by females in the sperm-storage tubules for 7-14 days.

quote.msg:
Lekking behaviour:
Males gather to engage a competitve displays. They fight each other in order to attract females.

Courtship feeding:
- the male bird offers food to his mate
- it occurs during egg formation, laying and incubation
- it can provide a valuable source of nutrients for females

Sperm competition:
The sperm will be stored by females in the sperm-storage tubules for 7-14 days.

replies.msg:
Egg formation:
Sperm fertilises ovum in the infundibulum.
The ovum passes down the tract receiving layers of albumen in process called "plumping".
Plumped egg calcified in uterus or shell gland.
Eggs laid normally once every 24 hours.

Breeding cycle:
1. Recuitment
2. Egg laying
3. Incubation
4. Chick rearing
5. Fledging

replies.msg:
Social mating systems
1. Monogamy: 1 male n 1 female
2. Polygyny: 1 male n 1+ females
3. Polyandry: 1 female n 1+ males
Social bonds are not sexual bonds. <85% of them are sexually polygamous.

Sexual mating systems
1. Extra-pair copulation:
1 female with 1+ male other than social mate
2. Intraspecific brood parasitism:
females lay eggs in another pair's nest
3. Rapid mate switching:
female laying eggs fertilised by previous social male

replies.msg:
Brood parasitism:
Female brood parasite watches the host nest constantly so she can lay eggs when the hosts not there.
She needs to match the reproductive state to the host female if she has to ovulate coincidentally.
The eggs must have smilar shape, size and colour to the host's if she has to avoid being detected.
The eggs have to be hard-shelled in order to avoid breakage during swift laying.

Apterygote:
- no wings
- metamorphosis slight or absent
- one or more pairs of pre-genital appendages on abdomen

Pterygote:
- winged
- metamorphosis occurs
- no pre-genital appendages on abdomen

Exopterygote:
- simple metamorphosis
- pupa rarely present
- wings developed externally
e.g. cockroaches

Endopterygote:
- complex metamorphossi
- pupa present
- wings developed internally
e.g. butterflies

Insect reproduction:
1. requires synchronisation
- get together at the right time and relevent resource
2. overt displays
- for not attracting the wrong species
3. attraction to resources (food)
4. pheromones (female)
5. copulation
6. swarms (mostly male)
- got massive resouces in one location
- females come in and have opportunity to make

Selfish genes:
It promotes its own survival without necessarily promotes survival of the organism, group or even species.

Termite Castes
1. Primary reproductives (eventually become king and queen)
- winged adults
Roles: Establish colony

2. Secondary (supplementary reproductive if either primary dies)
- wingless adults

3. Workers
- wingless and sterile
Roles: Foraging, food storage, brood/nest maintenance

4. Soldiers
- wingless and sterile
Roles: Defense

Wasps
Spring: building new colony
Autumn: emerge from dying colonies
Winter: mating

Ants:
There are two female castes: queen and workers.
The queens and males have wings but lost after mating and then the male dies.

Poikilothermy:
The body temperature varies considerably in response to the environmental change.

Homeothermy:
- it maintains a stable body temperature by regulating metabolic processes.
- its body temperature is higher than external environment.

Thermoregulatory mechanisms:
1. Ectothermy
uses environmental heat sources to regulate body temperature
2. Endothermy
generates heat internally through high metabolic rate to maintain a high body temperature

The animal must balance the heat generation and heat loss to the environment in order to maintain a stable body temperature.

Reducing heat loss:
1. mammal hair is excellent for insulating heat loss
2. blubber, fine insulating hair and guard hair
This gives off no detectable heat when sleeping.

Overheat:
- move slowly and rest often
- excess heat loss where fur is absent and the blood vessels close to skin
- swim to cool down
- the fur can moult.

increasing heat:
1. shivering and exercise
- generate extra heat through direct muscular heat production

Flight
Pterosaurs:
- elongated metacarpal n phalange V
Bats:
- elongated metacarpals n phalanges
Birds:
- feathers are stiff so dont need extend limb

Swimming
- greatly reduced upper limb

Terrestrial Locomotion
Plantigrade: power/digging (hand)
Digitigrade: speed (hunting) (fingers)
Unguligrade: speed (escaping) (fingertips)
Power: Femur>tibia n fibula
Speed: tibia n fibula>Femur

Mammalian characteristics:
- vertebrates (internal skeleton)
- mammary glands (milk)
- high metabolic rate
- hair/fur
- nails, hoof n horns
- diaphragm
- throacic ribs (protect heart n lungs only)
Stance:
- erect
- legs held under body
- swing in vertical plane
- better for weight bearing

Dorsi-ventral flexure of the spine:
- spine flexes vertically
- seen in carnivores

replies.msg: 宜家我間房好能養眼

quote.msg: 宜家我間房好能養眼

replies.msg:
其實作為黃絲 [共產黨信唔過]真係3歲就識既常識黎
但就係太常識 好容易忽略左呢個point





呢張文宣好簡單 message得一個
就係透過强調對共產黨既不信用
將中共塑造成全世界既敵人


中共既敵人有好多個
1. 黃絲
2. 所謂中立 其實只係顧及自身利益 點會信中共
3. 淺藍好多都唔信任中共 只係無腦崇拜權威 實例就係當年就大把人偷渡落黎
4. 全世界其他民主國家盟友

5.仲有個bonus
少數係大陸覺醒左既人 例如品葱上就有唔少
加上其他冇機會出聲既大陸人 （或者出左聲我地唔冇機會睇到）
佢地係日常生活遇到既不公義一定唔會少過我地
而黨媒又一定會大肆報導香港所有活動
只要每個鏡頭都充滿住反共訊息
就可以透過黨媒向中國輸出對中共既不信用！

黎緊831五周年
一人同我拎一張！！！！

如果大家想既
仲可以印貼紙印滿成個香港！
